mods.abstract: RUNAWAYS IN JAIL. WAS COMMITTED TO THE PARISH JAIL., on the 9th of July, two negro male slaves: one, calls himself RICHARD, is about forty years of age, dark complexion with whiskers, and is about five feet, five or six inches in height. The other, calls himself HENRY, is about the same height and complexion of Richard, and thirty-five or forty years of age. They say that they belong to Mr. Octave Collom, who resides in the Parish of St. James, and that they have been out about two weeks. The owner of said negroes is requested to come forward, prover property, pay charges and take them away, or they will be dealt with according to law. JOS. WHITEHEAD, Jailor. july 11, 1857
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
